title: St. Vincent Ferrer Novena
description: St Vincent Ferrer was a Spanish Dominican priest and confessor renowned for his preaching and learning. He is the patron saint of Valencia, Spain, and of builders because he built up the Church.

days.prayer:
üì± 

@media (max-width: 768px) { #branch-daily-prayer-9 .notice--info { padding: 16px 14px !important; } #branch-daily-prayer-9 a > div:last-child { padding: 16px 20px !important; font-size: 1.1em !important; } }

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

O Saint Vincent Ferrer, our guardian, because God our eternal Father has blessed you with an inexhaustible fountain of grace and blessing, we beg you to hear our prayers and to assist us with your powerful intercession which is even more effective now that you are in heaven than it was when you were on earth. Full of confidence in your mercy and compassion, we kneel in prayer before you, and commend to your powerful intercession all our needs, those of our families, our friends, relatives, and especially (mention request here‚Ä¶)

Glorious Saint Vincent Ferrer, let not our hope and confidence in your protection be deceived. Intercede for us before the throne of God. Watch over our eternal welfare. If our trials and tribulations in this world multiply, may they serve to give us spiritual joy and happiness. If God will only grant us the grace of ever increasing patience to the end that we may save our souls. Amen

In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.

More About St Vincent

What Was St Vincent Ferrer Known For?

St Vincent Ferrer was a Spanish Dominican priest and confessor renowned for his preaching and learning.

He sought to convince the Pope in Avignon to heal the great schism going on at the time, where multiple bishops claimed the papal throne, but he was unsuccessful at the time.

He desired no honors or titles and instead became a missionary throughout Europe. God blessed his preaching with miracles and many people were converted to Christ and His Church.

Near the end of his life he saw the healing of the schism with the election of Pope Martin V. He died April 5th, 1419.

St Vincent Ferrer is the patron saint of Valencia, Spain, and of builders because, like St Francis of Assisi, he built up the Church, which at the time had serious fractures in it.
